title: Drawings from the Daniels Collection
description: This exhibit featured work collected by actor and singer David Daniels. Many recognizable names were found within the collection, such as Bernini, Watteau, Boucher, Prud’hon, Ingres, Daumier, Manet, Degas, Toulouse-Lautrec, Seurat, and Picasso. The exhibit featured work from as early as the 16th century and focused primarily on European and American artists. Over 80 works were shown in all, and reflected the collector’s refined taste and the quality of his selections.
